string-array.name: bioquestion1
string-array.item: Which of the following statementes is true regarding anabolism?
Anabolism uses the process of hydrolysis to join molecules together.
Anabolism is the sum of all the chemical reactions in a cell.
Energy is released during anabolic reactions.
In anabolism, larger molecules are made from smaller molecules.

string-array.name: bioquestion2
string-array.item: A+B+energy⟶AB \n Which of the following best describes the above reaction?
It is a hydrolysis reaction.
It is a catabolic reaction.
It is an exergonic reaction.
It is an anabolic reaction.

string-array.name: bioquestion3
string-array.item: Which statement is true regarding catabolic pathways?
Molecules are synthesized during using dehydration synthesis.
Catabolic reactions consume energy.
Catabolic pathways are used to construct macromolecules such as carbohydrates, lipids, and proteins
Polymers are broken down into their monomers.

string-array.name: bioquestion4
string-array.item: What is the relationship between anabolic and catabolic pathways?
Anabolic and catabolic pathways are interchangeable.
Catabolic pathways synthesize complex molecules that are destroyed by anabolism.
Molecules broken down by anabolic pathways provides energy for catabolic pathways.
Anabolic pathways create complex molecules using the energy from catabolic pathways.

string-array.name: bioquestion5
string-array.item: Which of the following molecules is used as "energy currency" for the cell?
Phosphate group
Water
ADP
ATP

string-array.name: bioquestion6
string-array.item: Which of the following are components of adenosine triphosphate (ATP)?
Deoxyribose, a cytosine base, and a triphosphate group.
Deoxyribose, an adenine base, and a triphosphate group.
Ribose, a cytosine base, and a triphosphate group.
Ribose, an adenine base, and a triphosphate group.

string-array.name: bioquestion7
string-array.item: What occurs when a phosphate-phosphate bond in an ATP molecule is broken?
Light energy is absorbed by chloroplasts.
Water is transported through the cell membrane.
Lysosomes release their contents into the cytoplasm.
Energy is released in a cell.

string-array.name: bioquestion8
string-array.item: How is ATP hydrolysis used to power other cellular reactions?
It adds a phosphate to ADP.
It produces water which is used to fuel other reactions.
It acts as an enzymatic catalyst.
It is coupled with endergonic reactions.

string-array.name: bioquestion9
string-array.item: Which of the following has the weakest bond strength?
Ionic bonds
Polar covalent bonds
Non-polar covalent
Hydrogen bonds

string-array.name: bioquestion10
string-array.item: Why is water so effective at hydrogen bonding?
There are two hydrogens, doubling the positive charge on the water molecule.
Hydrogen is more electronegative than oxygen, so it is more likely to donate its elections to oxygen.
The hydrogens in water are ionically bonded to the oxygen.
Oxygen is very electronegative and strongly attracts hydrogen’s election.

string-array.name: bioquestion11
string-array.item: Which of the following explains why water is a good solvent for polar and ionic compounds?
Water is a non-coovalent molecule.
Water is a hydrophobic moledule.
Water is an ionic compound.
Water is a polar molecule.

string-array.name: bioquestion12
string-array.item: Why is water unable to dissolve substances like oil?
Water is nonpolar and oil is polar.
Both water and oil are nonpolar.
Both water and oil are polar.
Water is polar and oil is nonpolar.

string-array.name: bioquestion13
string-array.item: Which of the following statements is true regarding water as a substance?
Water is a non-polar solvent.
A water solution is also known as an aqueous solution.
All solutes dissolve easily in water.
Ionic substances are insoluble in water.

string-array.name: bioquestion14
string-array.item: Which of the following scenarios is an example of cohesion?
Water molecules stick to the surface of a mirror.
Water sticks to the walls of blood vessels.
Water is attracted to the surface of the needle.
Water molecules stick to one another and form a bead.

string-array.name: bioquestion15
string-array.item: Which of the following describes surface tension in water?
Surface tension occurs due to ionic bonding.
Surface tension is caused by water molecules repelling one another.
Surface tension of water is weakened by hydrogen bonding.
Surface tension allows water to support small objects if they are placed carefully on its surface.

string-array.name: bioquestion16
string-array.item: Which property of water is directly responsible for lowering body heat with sweat?
Cohesion
Surface tension
Heat capacity
Heat of vaporization
